abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The watchOS 8.5 SDK provides support to develop watchOS apps for Apple Watch devices running watchOS 8.5. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 13.3.1, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 13.3.1, see
Developers are able to express the preference for payment networks in
. Network preference is determined by the order of
. This won’t override the user’s default card selection, but if the card is multi-SSD, then the network preference order determines which SSD is selected. (80827905)
The following new C++20 and C++23 features are now implemented:
were removed to fix bugs caused by those extensions:
Tuples can no longer be constructed from fewer than the number of elements in the tuple. Previously, elements that weren’t specified were default-constructed; now this is a compiler error.
A tuple can no longer be constructed from an array.
type traits are no longer available in C++20 mode, as specified in the Standard.
Siri may not properly recognize the user’s speech on Apple Watch Series 3. (86107552)

has three new methods to simulate a subscription requiring price increase consent, simulate consenting to a pending price increase, and simulate declining a price increase in automated tests. (84556183)

has two new Boolean properties to simulate billing retry and grace period in automated tests. You can identify and simulate the resolution of billing retry issues using the same APIs as interrupted purchases. (83956205)

Users can now test the billing retry and grace period states using StoreKit Testing in Xcode. Use Xcode 13.3 or later to enable billing retry testing and toggle whether the app offers a grace period. Use
to handle these states in the app. (83938270)
Users can test subscription price increase behavior using StoreKit Testing in Xcode. Use Xcode 13.3 or later to set a price increase, then use
instance property. This property can be used to get a human-readable description of the value, localized for the device’s current locale. These types include:

abstract.text: An object that represents a request for payment, including details about payment-processing capabilities, the payment amount, and shipping information.
The payment methods that you support.
The types of in-app purchases.
The reason the auto-renewable subscription expired.
The date the billing grace period expires for the auto-renewable subscription.
A Boolean value that indicates whether an auto-renewable subscription is in the billing retry period.
The status that indicates whether the auto-renewable subscription is subject to a price increase.
The renewal states of auto-renewable subscriptions.
The types of offers for auto-renewable subscriptions.
The payment modes for subscription offers that apply to a transaction.
Units of time that describe subscription periods.
Asks the system to display the price consent sheet if the user hasn’t yet responded to a subscription price increase.
Asks the delegate whether to immediately display a price consent sheet.
The types of subscription offers for auto-renewable subscriptions.
The types the system uses to describe whether the user purchased the product or it’s available to them through Family Sharing.
Reasons that describe why the App Store may refund a transaction or revoke it from Family Sharing.
The controls and environment configuration you use to test StoreKit transactions in Xcode.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
A specialized error that provides localized messages describing the error and why it occurred.
